results.title: The Meaning of adolescence
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Adolescent Development”.
Describes the status of the adolescent , in relation to the social, emotional, mental and physical changes occurring in the years between childhood and adulthood. Points out that adults, through proper understanding, can help the teenager adjust to aspects of adult life.

results.title: Emotional maturity
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Adolescent Development”.
A docu-drama depicting the immature behaviour of an adolescent boy who fails to channel his emotions into positive feelings and actions. After being rejected by his girlfriend, Dave seeks revenge by slashing her new boyfriend’s tyres. Deeper investigation suggests that Dave’s parents have contributed to his ‘emotional instability’ by treating him like a child.

results.title: Discipline during adolescence
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Adolescent Development”.
Discusses the age-old question of how much discipline is good for adolescents. Results of too much and too little parental control are dramatized in a typical family setting.

results.title: Age of turmoil
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Adolescent Development”.
Focuses on the behaviour that reflects the emotional turmoil of early adolescence including giggling, destructive criticism of school, unrealistic ideas of their future, hours spent in seemingly useless activity. Most of the scenes are set in the home and show parents making appropriate and inappropriate responses. Different personality types, such as the leader and the quiet type have been selected to illustrate this budding stage. Produced for the parents of teenagers, not the teenagers themselves. Girls are chided for “their unrealistic ideas of their own future.” Boys are criticized for the way they “seem to spend hours in completely useless activity.”

results.title: Duplicating and manuscript
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Advanced Typing”.
Demonstrates the correct methods of making masters for duplicating machine use, correcting mistakes on a stencil, the use of the illuminated drawing board for tracing lines, making hectograph masters, correcting mistakes when using hectograph ribbon, or carbon, use of electromatic hectograph machine, use of various types of duplicating machines, and typing manuscripts with footnotes. Centering on a typewriter improving characters or marks that do not appear on the keyboard, and reading proof readers’ marks are also explained.

Centering on a typewriter improving characters or marks that do not appear on the keyboard, and reading proof readers’ marks are also explained.

results.title: Short Cuts
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Advanced Typing”.
Stresses the importance of having good posture and of having equipment and materials arranged for maximum efficiency. Demonstrates how to use tab stops, tab bar and decimal tabulator key. Shows the handling of carbon packs, use of the pressure indicator; correct method for making erasures, insertion of missing words and letters, removal of extra words and letters, typing cards, envelopes and labels, drawing vertical and horizontal lines.

results.title: The Eldorado Museum
results.creator_credit: Roberto Salvatore, Shelley Matulick, ACMI Content Development and ACMI
results.brief_description: Sue Phillips, Sandra Buchan and Geoff Milne take us on a tour of the Eldorado Museum and share the rich history of the pioneering families who established infrastructure and made the northern Victorian town of Eldorado what it is in 2012.

results.title: Alternative Lifestyles
results.brief_description: From bubble-wrap insulation to a Buddhist stupa, experience alternative living in Mt Best. Meet Dr Chalko and his environmentally sustainable house and see how he converted a freezer into a fridge that uses less power per hour than a light bulb uses per day. Michael and Mary moved to Mt Best to find peace and to live in harmony with their surrounds, in the process they built a Stupa and a labyrinth in their backyard and invite anyone who wishes to come and contemplate a moment of their time.

results.title: The Greta Bunyip Newsletter
results.creator_credit: Csilla Csongvay, Shelley Matulick, ACMI Content Development and ACMI
results.brief_description: In the digital age it’s all well and good for those who are connected via high speed internet, but in some rural towns it is the good old fashioned newsletter that keeps locals in the know. The Bunyip Newsletter is hand-delivered across the wider Greta area by six committed volunteers. We meet Noeleen Lloyd and Allan Porker as well as local historian Joan Ellis and hear about the importance of having a local newsletter. ‘The Bunyip’ was born out of a demand from the locals to be better informed and more connected to their community and surrounds. Over 300 newsletters are distributed every two months containing articles of historical, sporting and community importance.
